SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A type of negative control primarily used in inhalation studies in which only air is administered to the test system.
A comparator that is expected to yield a negative result, to establish a reference baseline.
A type of negative control in which the amount of food provided to the control group matches the amount of food consumed by a group receiving the investigational test agent.
A comparator that is expected to yield a positive result, to establish a reference baseline.
A type of negative control in which a procedure is performed that mimics the procedure under study but does not include investigational processes or components.
A type of negative control in which nothing is administered, delivered, or done to the test system.
A type of negative control containing the substance used for administration or delivery of the investigational test agent.
